summary: In 2010, less than 2/3 of households responded to the U.S. Census Bureau's mailed questionnaire. When there's no response, a census worker follows up with a visit—a time-consuming and costly operation. The Bureau recently ran a full Census test, which included the operations, systems, and procedures needed to count households that didn't respond. Workers followed up with more than 140,000 households in Rhode Island. After...
title: 2020 Census: Additional Steps Needed to Finalize Readiness for Peak Field Operations
